title: Game of Thrones & House of the Dragon Trivia (100 Questions)

questions.question: What is the name of the ancestral Valyrian steel greatsword of House Stark?
questions.explanation: Ice was the ancestral greatsword of House Stark, famously used by Eddard Stark. It was later melted down to create Oathkeeper and Widow's Wail.

questions.question: What is the name of Jon Snow's direwolf?
questions.explanation: Ghost is the albino direwolf belonging to Jon Snow. The other direwolves belonged to his Stark siblings.

questions.question: Who gifted Arya Stark her sword, Needle?
questions.explanation: Jon Snow had Needle commissioned from Mikken, the blacksmith at Winterfell, and gave it to Arya as a parting gift.

questions.question: What name does Theon Greyjoy give himself after being broken by Ramsay Bolton?
questions.explanation: Ramsay Bolton tortured Theon and forced him to adopt the new name 'Reek', shattering his original identity.

questions.question: Which Stark sibling becomes the Three-Eyed Raven?
questions.explanation: After traveling beyond the Wall, Bran Stark is trained by the previous Three-Eyed Raven and eventually takes his place.

questions.question: Who was Robb Stark's wife, whose marriage broke his oath to Walder Frey?
questions.explanation: Robb Stark fell in love with and married Talisa Maegyr from Volantis, breaking his promise to marry one of Walder Frey's daughters.

questions.question: What is the motto of House Stark?
questions.explanation: The words of House Stark are 'Winter is Coming', a constant warning and reminder of the need for vigilance.

questions.question: Who was Sansa Stark's first fiancé?
questions.explanation: Sansa was originally betrothed to Prince Joffrey Baratheon as part of the alliance between Houses Stark and Baratheon.

questions.question: What is the name of Catelyn Stark's ancestral home?
questions.explanation: Catelyn was born a Tully, and the ancestral seat of House Tully is Riverrun.

questions.question: What is the name of Rickon Stark's direwolf?
questions.explanation: Rickon, the youngest Stark, named his wild and aggressive direwolf Shaggydog.

questions.question: What are the official words of House Lannister?

choices.A: A Lannister Always Pays His Debts

questions.explanation: The official motto of House Lannister is 'Hear Me Roar!'. 'A Lannister Always Pays His Debts' is their well-known unofficial motto.

questions.question: Who murdered Tywin Lannister?
questions.explanation: Tyrion Lannister killed his father, Tywin, with a crossbow while Tywin was on the privy, just after freeing Tyrion from his cell.

questions.question: What is Jaime Lannister's nickname?
questions.explanation: Jaime earned the infamous nickname 'Kingslayer' after he killed King Aerys II Targaryen, whom he was sworn to protect.

questions.question: What substance did Cersei Lannister use to destroy the Great Sept of Baelor?
questions.explanation: Cersei used a massive cache of wildfire stored beneath the Great Sept to kill all her enemies inside, including the High Sparrow and Margaery Tyrell.

questions.question: What was the name of the poison used to kill Joffrey Baratheon?
questions.explanation: Joffrey was poisoned at his own wedding (the Purple Wedding) with a rare poison known as The Strangler, administered by Olenna Tyrell.

questions.question: Who served as Tyrion's champion in his first trial by combat at the Eyrie?
questions.explanation: The sellsword Bronn volunteered to fight for Tyrion against Ser Vardis Egen, winning Tyrion's freedom.

questions.question: In which city was Myrcella Baratheon (Lannister) killed?
questions.explanation: Myrcella was poisoned with a kiss by Ellaria Sand in Sunspear, the capital of Dorne, as revenge for Oberyn Martell's death.

questions.question: What is the name of the mountain-sized knight who serves Cersei?
questions.explanation: Ser Gregor Clegane, 'The Mountain', was fatally wounded by Oberyn Martell but 'reanimated' by Qyburn to serve as Ser Robert Strong, Cersei's silent bodyguard.

questions.question: Who was Joffrey's younger brother who also sat on the Iron Throne?
questions.explanation: Tommen Baratheon, Joffrey's more gentle younger brother, became King after Joffrey's assassination.

questions.question: What is the name of the ancestral home of House Lannister?
questions.explanation: Casterly Rock, a fortress carved into a massive rock overlooking the Sunset Sea, is the seat of House Lannister.

questions.question: How many dragons did Daenerys Targaryen hatch?
questions.explanation: Daenerys hatched three dragon eggs in Khal Drogo's funeral pyre: Drogon (black), Rhaegal (green), and Viserion (cream/gold).

questions.question: What is the name of Daenerys's eldest brother, who was killed by Khal Drogo?
questions.explanation: Viserys Targaryen, the 'Beggar King', was killed by Khal Drogo, who gave him a 'crown' of molten gold.

questions.question: What is the real name of Jon Snow, revealing his Targaryen heritage?
questions.explanation: Bran's vision reveals that Jon Snow's true name, given by his mother Lyanna Stark, is Aegon Targaryen.

questions.question: Which of Daenerys's dragons is killed and reanimated by the Night King?
questions.explanation: Viserion is killed by an ice spear thrown by the Night King, who then raises him from the dead as an ice dragon.

questions.question: Who was Daenerys's first husband?
questions.explanation: Daenerys was married to the Dothraki warlord Khal Drogo in an alliance arranged by her brother, Viserys.

questions.question: What are the words of House Targaryen?
questions.explanation: The motto of House Targaryen is 'Fire and Blood', reflecting their connection to dragons and their history of conquest.

questions.question: Who was Jon Snow's father?
questions.explanation: It is revealed that Jon Snow is not Eddard Stark's bastard, but the trueborn son of Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Stark.

questions.question: What is the name of the commander of Daenerys's Unsullied army?
questions.explanation: The Unsullied chose Grey Worm as their commander after Daenerys freed them from their masters in Astapor.

questions.question: Which Maester at Castle Black was secretly a Targaryen?
questions.explanation: Maester Aemon Targaryen was the brother of King Aegon V ('Egg') and abdicated any claim to the throne to serve at the Wall.

questions.question: Who ultimately kills Daenerys Targaryen?
questions.explanation: Fearing her tyranny after the destruction of King's Landing, Jon Snow kills Daenerys in the throne room.

questions.question: What is the motto of House Greyjoy?
questions.explanation: 'We Do Not Sow' is the motto of House Greyjoy, reflecting their reaving culture from the Iron Islands.

questions.question: What god does Melisandre worship?
questions.explanation: Melisandre is a Red Priestess who worships R'hllor, the Lord of Light, and believes Stannis Baratheon is a prophesied hero.

questions.question: What is the name of House Tarly's ancestral Valyrian steel sword?
questions.explanation: Heartsbane is the Valyrian steel greatsword belonging to House Tarly, which Samwell Tarly steals from his father.

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Knight of Flowers'?
questions.explanation: Ser Loras Tyrell, brother of Margaery, is famed for his beauty and skill at tourneys, earning him the nickname 'Knight of Flowers'.

questions.question: What is the motto of House Martell?
questions.explanation: The words of House Martell of Dorne are 'Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken', reflecting their history of resisting Targaryen conquest.

questions.question: What is the name of Sandor Clegane's older brother?
questions.explanation: Sandor's older brother is Ser Gregor Clegane, 'The Mountain', who famously scarred Sandor as a child.

questions.question: Which house is in charge of The Eyrie?
questions.explanation: House Arryn rules the Vale from their impregnable fortress, The Eyrie.

questions.question: Who is Lord of Highgarden at the beginning of the series?
questions.explanation: Mace Tyrell is the Lord of Highgarden and head of House Tyrell. Olenna is his mother, and Loras is his son.

questions.question: What is the motto of House Tully?
questions.explanation: The words of House Tully of Riverrun, Catelyn Stark's birth house, are 'Family, Duty, Honor'.

questions.question: Which king did Stannis Baratheon serve as Master of Ships?
questions.explanation: Stannis served on the small council as Master of Ships for his older brother, King Robert Baratheon.

questions.question: What is the name of the sellsword company founded by the 'Second Sons'?
questions.explanation: The 'Second Sons' is the name of the sellsword company that Daario Naharis, and later Tyrion and Jorah, are involved with.

questions.question: Who says the line: 'Chaos is a ladder'?
questions.explanation: Littlefinger explains his philosophy of using disruption to advance his own position to Varys, concluding that 'chaos is a ladder'.

questions.question: What is the name of Robert Baratheon's bastard son who works as a blacksmith?
questions.explanation: Gendry is one of King Robert's many bastard sons, who works as a blacksmith's apprentice in King's Landing before fleeing with Arya.

questions.question: What is the motto of House Tyrell?
questions.explanation: The words of House Tyrell of Highgarden are 'Growing Strong', symbolizing their wealth and fertile lands.

questions.question: Who is known as 'The Queen of Thorns'?
questions.explanation: Lady Olenna Tyrell, grandmother of Margaery and Loras, is known for her sharp wit and political savvy, earning her the nickname 'Queen of Thorns'.

questions.question: What is the name of the massacre where Robb and Catelyn Stark were killed?
questions.explanation: The Red Wedding was a massacre orchestrated by Walder Frey and Roose Bolton (in league with the Lannisters) to betray and murder Robb Stark, Catelyn Stark, and his army.

questions.question: Which continent lies to the east of Westeros?
questions.explanation: Essos is the large continent to the east of Westeros, separated by the Narrow Sea. It's home to the Free Cities, Dothraki, and Slaver's Bay.

questions.question: What is the name of the organization that Arya Stark joins in Braavos?
questions.explanation: Arya travels to the House of Black and White in Braavos to train as one of the Faceless Men, a guild of assassins who worship the Many-Faced God.

questions.question: What is the common saying that follows 'Valar Morghulis'?
questions.explanation: 'Valar Morghulis' is High Valyrian for 'All men must die'. The traditional response is 'Valar Dohaeris', meaning 'All men must serve'.

questions.question: What is the name of the massive battle where Jon Snow's army defeats Ramsay Bolton's?
questions.explanation: Jon Snow and Ramsay Bolton fight for control of Winterfell in the 'Battle of the Bastards', which is won when the Knights of the Vale arrive.

questions.question: What is the capital of the Seven Kingdoms?
questions.explanation: King's Landing, located on the east coast of Westeros, is the capital of the Seven Kingdoms and the seat of the Iron Throne.

questions.question: What is the name of the religion dominant in the Seven Kingdoms?
questions.explanation: The Faith of the Seven is the primary religion in the southern and central parts of Westeros, worshipping a single god with seven aspects.

questions.question: What is the substance used to kill White Walkers?
questions.explanation: White Walkers can be killed by two known substances: Dragonglass (obsidian) and Valyrian steel.

questions.question: Who was the first of the 'New Men' to be elected Lord Commander of the Night's Watch?
questions.explanation: Jon Snow is elected as the 998th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch after his bravery during the Battle of Castle Black.

questions.question: What is the name of the citadel where Maesters are trained?
questions.explanation: The Citadel, located in the ancient city of Oldtown, is the center of learning in Westeros and the place where men train to become Maesters.

questions.question: Who is the mother of King Aegon II, Aemond, and Helaena Targaryen?
questions.explanation: Queen Alicent Hightower is the second wife of King Viserys I and the mother of the 'Green' claimants to the throne.

questions.question: What is the name of King Aegon II's golden dragon?
questions.explanation: Aegon II rides the magnificent golden dragon Sunfyre, considered one of the most beautiful dragons ever seen.

questions.question: How does Prince Aemond Targaryen lose his eye?

choices.B: In a fight with Lucerys Velaryon

questions.explanation: Aemond loses his eye in a childhood fight with his nephew, Lucerys Velaryon, after Aemond claims the dragon Vhagar.

questions.question: Who is Alicent Hightower's father, who serves as Hand of the King?
questions.explanation: Otto Hightower serves as Hand of the King to both Jaehaerys I and Viserys I, and is the chief architect of the Green council.

questions.question: Which massive, ancient dragon does Aemond Targaryen claim?
questions.explanation: Aemond claims Vhagar, the oldest and largest living dragon, who was once ridden by Queen Visenya during Aegon's Conquest.

questions.question: Who is known as 'The Clubfoot' and serves as Lord of Harrenhal and Master of Whisperers?
questions.explanation: Larys 'Clubfoot' Strong is the cunning and ruthless spymaster who aligns himself with Queen Alicent and the Greens.

questions.question: What is the name of Helaena Targaryen's dragon?
questions.explanation: Helaena Targaryen, wife and sister to Aegon II, rides the dragon Dreamfyre.

questions.question: Who is the primary knight and protector of Queen Alicent, known for his unwavering loyalty?
questions.explanation: Ser Criston Cole, once Princess Rhaenyra's protector, becomes Queen Alicent's staunchest defender and Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.

questions.question: What symbol does Alicent Hightower wear to signal the start of her faction at Rhaenyra's wedding feast?

choices.D: The Faith of the Seven's star

questions.explanation: Alicent interrupts the feast by arriving in a green dress, the color of the Hightower beacon, signaling her defiance and the formation of 'the Greens'.

questions.question: What tragic event is known as 'Blood and Cheese'?

choices.C: The murder of Aegon II's son

questions.explanation: As revenge for Lucerys's death, Daemon Targaryen hires two assassins (Blood and Cheese) who infiltrate the Red Keep and murder Aegon II's young son, Jaehaerys.

questions.question: Who does King Viserys I name as his official heir?
questions.explanation: After the death of his first wife and infant son, King Viserys I breaks tradition and names his daughter, Princess Rhaenyra, as his heir.

questions.question: What is the name of Princess Rhaenyra's yellow dragon?
questions.explanation: Rhaenyra has ridden the she-dragon Syrax since she was a young girl.

questions.question: Who is Princess Rhaenyra's second husband?
questions.explanation: After her first husband, Laenor Velaryon, fakes his death, Rhaenyra marries her uncle, Prince Daemon Targaryen.

questions.question: What is the name of Prince Daemon Targaryen's fearsome red dragon?
questions.explanation: Daemon Targaryen, a fierce warrior, rides the formidable and battle-hardened red dragon Caraxes, also known as the 'Blood Wyrm'.

questions.question: Who is known as 'The Queen Who Never Was'?
questions.explanation: Princess Rhaenys Targaryen, wife of Corlys Velaryon, was passed over for the throne in favor of her cousin Viserys, earning her the title 'The Queen Who Never Was'.

questions.question: What is the name of Lord Corlys Velaryon's nickname, referring to his many voyages?
questions.explanation: Lord Corlys Velaryon is famed for his 'Nine Voyages' to Essos, which brought immense wealth to his house, earning him the name 'The Sea Snake'.

questions.question: What is the name of Rhaenyra's eldest son, who rides the dragon Vermax?
questions.explanation: Jacaerys Velaryon is Rhaenyra's first-born son and heir, and he rides the dragon Vermax.

questions.question: Which of Rhaenyra's sons is killed by Aemond Targaryen at Storm's End, sparking the war?
questions.explanation: Prince Lucerys Velaryon is killed along with his dragon Arrax by Aemond and Vhagar, marking the first kinslaying of the Dance of the Dragons.

questions.question: What is the name of Princess Rhaenys's red dragon?
questions.explanation: Princess Rhaenys Targaryen rides the swift and powerful red dragon Meleys, known as the 'Red Queen'.

questions.question: Who is rumored to be the real father of Rhaenyra's first three sons?
questions.explanation: It is widely rumored at court that Rhaenyra's sons Jacaerys, Lucerys, and Joffrey are the bastards of Ser Harwin Strong, not Laenor Velaryon.

questions.question: What is the name of the Targaryen civil war chronicled in 'House of the Dragon'?
questions.explanation: The Dance of the Dragons is the name given to the brutal civil war fought between Rhaenyra's 'Blacks' and Aegon II's 'Greens' for the Iron Throne.

questions.question: What is the ancestral seat of House Velaryon?
questions.explanation: House Velaryon, a family of Valyrian descent, rules from the island of Driftmark in Blackwater Bay. Their castle is also called High Tide.

questions.question: What ailment plagues King Viserys I throughout the show?
questions.explanation: King Viserys suffers from a severe, progressive illness that rots his flesh, often compared to leprosy, which he endures for decades.

questions.question: What is the name of the prophecy King Viserys shares with Rhaenyra?

choices.B: A Song of Ice and Fire

questions.explanation: Viserys passes down the secret prophecy of Aegon the Conqueror, 'A Song of Ice and Fire', which foretells the coming of the White Walkers.

questions.question: Who was the rider of Balerion the Black Dread?
questions.explanation: Balerion the Black Dread was ridden by Aegon I during the conquest. King Viserys I was the last person to ride him, but he was most famously Aegon's dragon.

questions.question: What is the name of Daemon Targaryen's Valyrian steel sword?
questions.explanation: Daemon Targaryen wields Dark Sister, one of the two ancestral Targaryen swords, famously wielded by Queen Visenya.

questions.question: What is the name of the alliance of Free Cities that wars with Daemon and Corlys in the Stepstones?
questions.explanation: The Triarchy is an alliance between the Free Cities of Myr, Lys, and Tyrosh, led by Craghas Drahar, 'The Crabfeeder'.

questions.question: What title does Daemon Targaryen claim after winning the war in the Stepstones?
questions.explanation: After defeating the Crabfeeder, Daemon's men crown him 'King of the Narrow Sea', a title he later relinquishes to his brother Viserys.

questions.question: How does Laena Velaryon, Daemon's second wife, die?

choices.B: Childbirth complications, then by her dragon

questions.explanation: After being unable to deliver her child, a dying Laena walks out and commands her dragon, Vhagar, to burn her, choosing a dragonrider's death.

questions.question: What is the name of the ancestral Targaryen Valyrian steel sword, wielded by King Viserys and Aegon II?
questions.explanation: Blackfyre is the sword of Aegon the Conqueror, passed down to subsequent Targaryen kings. Viserys wields it, and the Greens give it to Aegon II.
